channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Allura
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Allura

item.title: CVE-2018-1319|2024-08-05T03:59:37.664Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20allura
item.description: In Apache Allura prior to 1.8.1, attackers may craft URLs that cause HTTP response splitting. If a victim goes to a maliciously crafted URL, unwanted results may occur including XSS or service denial for the victim's browsing session.

item.title: CVE-2018-1299|2024-08-05T03:59:37.649Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20allura
item.description: In Apache Allura before 1.8.0, unauthenticated attackers may retrieve arbitrary files through the Allura web application. Some webservers used with Allura, such as Nginx, Apache/mod_wsgi or paster may prevent the attack from succeeding. Others, such as gunicorn do not prevent it and leave Allura vulnerable.

item.title: CVE-2024-36471|2024-08-02T03:37:05.234Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20allura
item.description:
Import functionality is vulnerable to DNS rebinding attacks between verification and processing of the URL. Project administrators can run these imports, which could cause Allura to read from internal services and expose them.
This issue affects Apache Allura from 1.0.1 through 1.16.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.17.0, which fixes the issue. If you are unable to upgrade, set "disable_entry_points.allura.importers = forge-tracker, forge-discussion" in your .ini config file.

item.title: CVE-2024-38379|2024-06-22T09:09:32.464Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20allura
item.description:
Apache Allura's neighborhood settings are vulnerable to a stored XSS attack. Only neighborhood admins can access these settings, so the scope of risk is limited to configurations where neighborhood admins are not fully trusted.
This issue affects Apache Allura: from 1.4.0 through 1.17.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.17.1, which fixes the issue.
